Key Match Events: Johnson Charles attacked left-arm quick Fazalhaq Farooqi and Azmatullah Omarzai and exploited the third man region with multiple boundaries.
Nicholas Pooran’s 53-ball knock of 98 set the stage for West Indies' victory.
Obed McCoy’s three for 14, including three wickets in eight balls, and Akeal Hosein’s wicket maiden in the first over derailed Afghanistan's chase.
Nicholas Pooran’s 53-ball 98 was the joint-most runs scored in an over in the T20 World Cup, after Yuvraj Singh’s six sixes against Stuart Broad in 2007.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies displayed their batting might against Afghanistan, amassing a formidable 218 for five.
Afghanistan’s hope dwindled rapidly after slipping from 45 for one to 63 for five within the first 10 overs.
Johnson Charles and Nicholas Pooran exploited gaps in Afghanistan's bowling attack.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies secured an unbeaten entry into the Super 8s with a 104-run victory against Afghanistan.
The result was a foregone conclusion by the end of Powell and Pooran’s partnership.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nicholas Pooran’s power-packed innings ended dramatically: a direct hit from Azmatullah Omarzai caught Pooran short of his first T20 World Cup century by two runs.
Pooran’s 53-ball knock was the joint-most runs scored in an over in the T20 World Cup, after Yuvraj Singh’s six sixes against Stuart Broad in 2007.
